titles.title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress with respect to drug and alcohol free cultural events for Native peoples and to commend Spirit Days, Inc., for sponsoring a drug and alcohol free cultural event for Alaska Natives living in an urban environment.

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.

bill.summary: 6/23/1988--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress: (1) supporting and encouraging drug and alcohol free events to celebrate the heritage of America's Native peoples; and (2) commending Spirit Days, Incorporated, for its role in providing a drug and alcohol free cultural event for urban Eskimos, Aleuts, and Indians in Alaska.
